title: Each created node returns with a valid ID
description:
* whenever a node is created the response has to contain an ID
  * returned as field `id` from type `number`
* the generated ID is returned as a number (integer) within the 32-bit space
  * this allows for up to 4 billion nodes → this will be more than enough for the next 10 or 20 years
  * how this number is internally stored doesn’t matter, as long as it is returned as described above
